content: Produce a pop-punk song about teenage angst and growing pains. The lyrics should resonate with younger audiences.

[Verse 1]
Wake up every morning, feelin' so alone
Same old routine, but I'm losin' my tone
School's a drag, teachers yell, I just wanna roam
But mom and dad, they don't understand my gloom

Friends are all different, they've got it all together
I'm just tryin' to fit in, but I'm stuck in this weather
Phones and social media, everyone's so fake
I just wanna be myself, but I can't seem to make it straight

[Chorus]
Teenage angst, it's takin' me down
Growing pains, I'm losin' ground
Every step feels like a mile
In this world, I'm tryin' to survive

[Verse 2]
Dating's a mess, heart's on the line
First love's a dream, but it's hard to define
Breakups hurt, tears fall like rain
But I gotta keep moving, can't stay in the same lane

Parents think they know, but they don't see
The pressure's on, can't escape this spree
Future's unclear, choices to make
I'm just trying to find my place

[Chorus]
Teenage angst, it's eatin' me alive
Growing pains, I can't seem to thrive
Each day's a battle, each night's a fight
In this maze, I'm losin' sight

[Pre-Chorus]
But I won't give up, I won't back down
I'll find my way, I've got this crown
Of thorns, maybe, but I'll wear it with pride
Because I'm young, and I'm alive

[Chorus]
Teenage angst, it's makin' me strong
Growing pains, they belong
To the journey, to the ride
In this life, I'm defying

[Outro]
So here's to the nights, filled with doubt and fear
To the mornings when hope is hard to hear
But I know that I'll rise, I'll overcome
With every scar, I'll become

Unbreakable, unstoppable, me
In this pop-punk world, I'm free

[End]
